text: Terrence LeVarr Thornton (born May 13, 1977), his stage name being Pusha T, A representative for Pusha-T confirmed to Pitchfork that the hyphen has, indeed, returned. is an American rapper and songwriter. He became famous as one-half of the Virginia-based hip hop duo Clipse, which was mainly active from 1994 to 2010, alongside his older brother No Malice. As Clipse, the two released three studio albums when he signed to Pharrell's Star Trak Entertainment. Clipse became best known for their 2002 first single "Grindin'". == References == Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:American rappers
title: Pusha T
